snippet: A new film being shown on PBS this week chronicles the Orchestre Septentrional of Haiti, which since 1948 has survived dictators, a devastating earthquake and the recent cholera epidemic.
abstract: Haitian band Orchestre Septentrional, little known outside Haiti since its founding in 1948, is in the middle of a North American tour and is the subject of Whitney Dow's documentary film When the Drum is Beating, which will be broadcast on PBS.
lead_paragraph: A new film being shown on PBS this week chronicles the Orchestre Septentrional of Haiti, which since 1948 has survived dictators, a devastating earthquake and the recent cholera epidemic.

headline.seo: ‘When the Drum Is Beating,’ About Orchestre Septentrional
headline.main: For 6 Decades, the Sound of Good News in Haiti
headline.print_headline: For 6 Decades, the Sound of Good News in Haiti
